Description: Fragment of thick, weft-faced plain weave, woollen fragment, mainly undyed, with three coloured bands; Outer two bands are red bordered with yellow and green, the central band is dark-blue bordered with yellow, red and dark-blue; The bands 2.2-2.5 cm deep and 4.2-4.4 cm apart; Along the lower edge a twisted closing cord preceded a line of twining in red, yellow, green, and orange threads grouped together - the twining (over two ends) mainly a single line but doubling back on itself at the corner and ending in a knot; Warp: S spun undyed wool, c.11tpc; Weft: S spun wool, undyed c.36tpc, red c.28tpc, dark blue c.32tpc; Edges: reinforced selvedge one side of two groups of warp threads and extra circuit of main weft, closing cord worked from corner inwards, upper edge torn, 2nd side cut in modern times
Curator's comments: Unreg. 26; Found in 1988? in Keeper's Room, previous location cupboard O; No traces of sewing so not likely from a tunic; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (12.2.1991)
